quiver
Class QItem

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--quiver.QItem
Direct Known Subclasses:
QArrow, QCommutativityRelation, QPoint, QZeroRelation
public abstract class QItem
extends Object

this is a base class for all items in a quiver, including points, arrows, and relations

Field Summary
static BasicStroke dotted
          this is a dotted stroke for drawing dotted lines (e.g., the curves which are used to indicate paths in relations
static Font labelFont
          a basic sans serif font for rendering labels on vertices
protected  boolean selected
          tells whether item is selected
static double snapTol
          returns the basic 'snap tolerance' for items, i.e., when selecting items with the mouse by clicking on them, the mouse must be within snap tolerance of the item for the selection to take effect.

Field Detail

snapTol

public static final double snapTol
returns the basic 'snap tolerance' for items, i.e., when selecting items with the mouse by clicking on them, the mouse must be within snap tolerance of the item for the selection to take effect. For some items, a smaller snap tolerance is appropriate (e.g., arrows), but this value is intended to apply to most items

selected

protected boolean selected
tells whether item is selected

dotted

public static BasicStroke dotted
this is a dotted stroke for drawing dotted lines (e.g., the curves which are used to indicate paths in relations

labelFont

public static Font labelFont
a basic sans serif font for rendering labels on vertices

Method Detail

select

public void select()
selects the item

toggleSelect

public void toggleSelect()
toggles the selection state of the item

unselect

public void unselect()
unselects the item

isSelected

public boolean isSelected()
returns true iff the item is selected

itemColor

public Color itemColor(boolean sel)
Returns the colors in which the item should be rendered in selected or non-selected states.
Parameters:
selected - specifies whether or not the item is selected

draw

public void draw(Graphics2D g)
Draws the item. This calls the drawItem method in derived classes to render the item
Parameters:
g - a graphics context onto which the item will be rendered

snapTol

public double snapTol()
returns the snap tolerance associated with an item. This method is provided so that we can require certain items in derived classes to override with a smaller snap tolerance.

drawItem

protected abstract void drawItem(Graphics2D g)
draws the item
Parameters:
g - a graphics context onto which the item will be rendered

distance

public abstract double distance(Point pt)
Calculates the distance of the item from a coordinate (e.g., a mouse click)
Parameters:
pt - a coordinate

isDeleteItem

public abstract boolean isDeleteItem()
Return true if item should be deleted (either because it is selected, or some item it depends on is selected)
